channel.title: Models
channel.description: For some reason my model is not showing up not sure what the problem is??

item.description:

Now check if that method is used in startUp.

Yes it’s fine i got the model to appear

item.title: Models
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:6, topic:551907”]Well I’d hope you weren’t looking in the server… The server doesn’t have anything to do with this.
And that also doesn’t tell me anything…

You need to find the method that uses the RAW folder… It will literally have that word somewhere in it, probably more than once.[/quote]

Okay i found it…
Edit: Also found this code public void preloadModels() { File file = new File("./Raw/"); File[] fileArray = file.listFiles(); for (int y = 0; y < fileArray.length; y++) { String s = fileArray[y].getName(); byte[] buffer = ReadFile("./Raw/" + s); Model.method460(buffer, Integer.parseInt(getFileNameWithoutExtension(s))); } }

public byte[] getModel(int Index) { try { File Model = new File(signlink.findcachedir() + "./pRaw/" + Index + ".dat"); byte[] aByte = new byte[(int) Model.length()]; FileInputStream fis = new FileInputStream(Model); fis.read(aByte); System.out.println("" + Index + " aByte = [" + aByte + "]!"); fis.close(); return aByte; } catch (Exception e) { return null; } }

Read full topic

item.title: Models
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Well I’d hope you weren’t looking in the server… The server doesn’t have anything to do with this.
And that also doesn’t tell me anything…

You need to find the method that uses the RAW folder… It will literally have that word somewhere in it, probably more than once.

Read full topic

item.title: Models
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:551907”][quote author=tank nation link=topic=670823.msg4485720#msg4485720 date=1433872901]

Make sure your client is preloading the models from the raw folder. And make sure the model id you used isn’t the wield model.

Also: You have anInt165 and anInt200 set to -1… Those are the male and female wield values… The crossbow will never show up when wielding if you don’t change those.

How can i tell if my client is preloading the models?
[/quote]
Read the code and look for a method using the raw folder…
Then look to see if your client uses said method in the startUp.[/quote]

Idk if this is the right one, but i found in client.java client sided… void startUp() { drawLoadingText(20, "Starting up"); new CacheDownloader(this).downloadCache(); if (signlink.sunjava) super.minDelay = 5; if (aBoolean993) { // rsAlreadyLoaded = true; // return; } aBoolean993 = true; getDocumentBaseHost(); if (signlink.cache_dat != null) { for (int i = 0; i < 5; i++) decompressors[i] = new Decompressor(signlink.cache_dat, signlink.cache_idx[i], i + 1); }

Read full topic

item.title: Models
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“tank nation, post:3, topic:551907”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=670823.msg4485700#msg4485700 date=1433867525]
Make sure your client is preloading the models from the raw folder. And make sure the model id you used isn’t the wield model.

Also: You have anInt165 and anInt200 set to -1… Those are the male and female wield values… The crossbow will never show up when wielding if you don’t change those.
[/quote]

How can i tell if my client is preloading the models?[/quote]
Read the code and look for a method using the raw folder…
Then look to see if your client uses said method in the startUp.

Read full topic

@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:551907”]Make sure your client is preloading the models from the raw folder. And make sure the model id you used isn’t the wield model.

Also: You have anInt165 and anInt200 set to -1… Those are the male and female wield values… The crossbow will never show up when wielding if you don’t change those.[/quote]

How can i tell if my client is preloading the models?

item.title: Models
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Make sure your client is preloading the models from the raw folder. And make sure the model id you used isn’t the wield model.

Also: You have anInt165 and anInt200 set to -1… Those are the male and female wield values… The crossbow will never show up when wielding if you don’t change those.

Read full topic
